A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Definitely has some very strong points as well as some holes too. If you view it with the idea that it's part of a trilogy and not a stand alone\, it's easier to accept it's flaws which surface as much of the movie feels like character development with a story interlaced (IE\, filler). I still thoroughly enjoyed it more than episodes 1-3. Not having Lucas with overarching control is the best thing to happen to this series since the original three.
